item.title: Hundreds from Met Police declare Freemasons links
item.description: Membership of the Freemasons or similar organisations became declarable in December.

item.title: Red Arrows get first woman leader
item.description: Wing Cdr Sasha Nash says it is the "opportunity of a lifetime" and hopes to inspire others.

item.title: Man jailed for killing golfer after police pursuit
item.description: The van was driven on to a golf course where mother-of-three Suzanne Cherry was hit by it.

item.title: Prescod 'not taking drugs' for Enhanced Games
item.description: Former Great Britain sprinter Reece Prescod says he will not take performance-enhancing drugs despite signing up for May's controversial Enhanced Games.

item.title: England do not have drinking problem - Broad
item.description: Former England seamer Stuart Broad says the current team do not have a drinking problem despite a series of incidents involving alcohol this winter.

item.title: BBC seeks dismissal of Trump's multi-billion dollar defamation lawsuit
item.description: Court papers filed on Monday show the broadcaster will argue the Florida court lacks "personal jurisdiction" over the BBC.

item.title: World central banks 'stand in solidarity' with Fed chair after US threatens criminal charges
item.description: Eleven central banks have backed Jerome Powell after the US launched a criminal investigation into the US Fed.

item.title: What countries do business with Iran and what could US tariffs mean?
item.description: Donald Trump has announced a 25% tariff on countries trading with Iran after its deadly crackdown on anti-government protests.

item.title: UK Sport eyeing record Winter Olympics medal haul
item.description: UK Sport believes Team GB could win a record-breaking eight medals at the upcoming Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics.

item.title: New Birmingham-Manchester rail link planned
item.description: Previous plans for a high-speed rail line between the cities were scrapped by Rishi Sunak's government.

item.title: Apple turns to Google to power AI upgrade for Siri
item.description: Analysts say the deal is likely to be welcomed by consumers - but reflects Apple's failure to develop its own AI tools.

item.title: Prosecutors seek death penalty for ex-South Korean president Yoon
item.description: Yoon is accused of leading an insurrection when he tried to impose martial law in 2024.

item.title: Le Pen hopeful appeal will allow her to run for French president
item.description: An appeal by France's far-right leader begins against a ruling banning her from running for public office for five years.

item.title: Cover-up law delayed after concerns it will not apply fully to MI5
item.description: The law would create a new legal duty on public bodies to tell the truth during investigations.

item.title: Stop saying we can't make things work, Streeting urges Labour colleagues
item.description: The health secretary warns a growing "excuses culture" is damaging Labour in a speech to a think tank.

item.title: Lib Dems set out plan to end 12-hour A&E waits
item.description: Party leader Ed Davey calls for Â£1.5bn to be spent on ending a "deadly corridor crisis" in the NHS.

item.title: Carrick to bring in Holland as Man Utd assistant
item.description: Michael Carrick agrees to become Manchester United interim head coach - and former England assistant manager Steve Holland is set to be his number two.

item.title: Harry Styles teases fourth album with cryptic posters
item.description: The posters bear the message "we belong together", superimposed over a photo of fans taken during his last world tour.

item.title: I spent months trying to find out if boosting my gut health could help me age better
item.description: Health editor Hugh Pym revamped his diet after a test suggested his gut health appeared to look five years older than he was

item.title: BTS fans ready as K-pop stars prepare for massive comeback
item.description: The world's biggest boy band are due to reveal their 2026 tour dates - why is it causing so much excitement?

item.title: Mandelson makes personal apology for continuing Epstein friendship
item.description: The former ambassador apologises "unequivocally" for maintaining links with Epstein after 2008 conviction

item.title: 'Doesn't matter if you're 18 or 35' - Edwards embraces England's future
item.description: England coach Charlotte Edwards backs her experienced core after her first year in the job but challenges the next generation to take their places.

item.title: VAR errors increase: Each of the 13 mistakes so far this season
item.description: The Premier League's KMI Panel makes judgements on every key decisions. Here's what they say the VAR has got wrong.

item.title: How Australian festival imploded after axing Palestinian author
item.description: Some 180 writers, including former New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, have withdrawn from the event.

item.title: Decision time for Trump on Iran but what does he ultimately want?
item.description: As Iran's deadly crackdown on anti-government protests continue, the US president is considering how best to respond.

item.title: Safe spaces needed for drug-addicted children, say grieving mums
item.description: More children in England are in drug and alcohol treatment, but families say many cannot get help.

item.title: 'We were tricked': How one woman lures foreign men to fight on Russia's front line
item.description: Recruits tell the BBC an ex-teacher who operates on Telegram misled them, saying they could avoid combat.

item.title: Why Michael Sheen put his money on the line for new Welsh national theatre
item.description: The actor discusses spearheading the Welsh National Theatre and starring in its first production.

item.description: The US president and his administration have threatened "very strong options" to intervene in Iran, including military action.

item.title: 'They just kept killing': Eyewitnesses describe deadly crackdown
item.description: The BBC has received eyewitness accounts of security forces attacking anti-government protesters across the country.

item.title: What a new law and an investigation could mean for Grok AI deepfakes
item.description: Elon Musk's chatbot is under fire for altering images of women to remove their clothes without their consent.

item.title: The Sadiq Khan Interview
item.description: Sadiq Khan speaks to Newscast about crime in London, social media and Europe.

item.title: Lyse Doucet: Iran's rulers face biggest challenge since 1979 revolution
item.description: The authorities are responding to protests with a ferocious security crackdown and near total internet shutdown.

item.description: Paul Young looks back on a career that saw him capture the hearts of a generation of fans.
